alert.note: Alert for Pulaski (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 3:31PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Wayne and southwestern Pulaski Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 329 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Faubush, or 14 miles north of Monticello, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Cains Store around 340 PM EDT. Faubush around 345 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Naomi, Nancy, Mill Springs, Pulaski County Park, Betsey, Frazer, Somerset, Burnside, Bronston, Quinton, General Burnside S.P., Somerset Pulaski Airport, Elihu and Kidder. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
